description: reindex returns a DataFrame conformed to the requested labels.
quote: Conform DataFrame to new index with optional filling logic.

description: Labels introduced by reindex are NaN by default when values are missing.
quote: Places NA/NaN in locations having no value in the previous index.

description: fill_value replaces missing values introduced by reindex.
quote: Value to use for missing values. Defaults to NaN, but can be any 'compatible' value.

description: fill_value supports non-numeric compatible values.
quote: df.reindex(new_index, fill_value='missing')

description: method='ffill'/'pad' propagates last valid observation forward.
quote: pad / ffill: Propagate last valid observation forward to next valid.

description: method='bfill'/'backfill' propagates next valid observation backward.
quote: backfill / bfill: Use next valid observation to fill gap.

description: method='nearest' fills gaps using nearest valid observation.
quote: nearest: Use nearest valid observations to fill gap.

description: method-based filling applies only to monotonic indexes.
quote: this is only applicable to DataFrames/Series with a monotonically increasing/decreasing index

description: method-based filling does not fill pre-existing NaN values in the original DataFrame.
quote: filling while reindexing does not look at DataFrame values, but only compares the original and desired indexes.

description: limit caps the maximum number of consecutive forward/backward fills.
quote: Maximum number of consecutive elements to forward or backward fill.

description: DataFrame.reindex supports keyword convention using index= and columns=.
quote: (index=index_labels, columns=column_labels, ...)

description: DataFrame.reindex supports labels with explicit axis convention.
quote: (labels, axis={'index', 'columns'}, ...)

description: axis accepts both axis names and numeric selectors.
quote: Can be either the axis name ('index', 'columns') or number (0, 1).

description: columns reindexing may introduce NaN for missing columns.
quote: df.reindex(columns=['http_status', 'user_agent'])

description: Scalar tolerance applies uniformly to all values.
quote: Tolerance may be a scalar value, which applies the same tolerance to all values.

description: List-like tolerance must match index size and exact index dtype.
quote: must be the same size as the index and its dtype must exactly match the index's type.

description: Tolerance matching follows the absolute-distance inequality.
quote: abs(index[indexer] - target) <= tolerance

description: level performs matching across the specified MultiIndex level.
quote: Broadcast across a level, matching Index values on the passed MultiIndex level.

description: copy keyword is ignored and has no effect on method behavior.
quote: This keyword is now ignored; changing its value will have no impact on the method.

description: Using Index objects for labels/index/columns is preferred to avoid data duplication.
quote: Preferably an Index object to avoid duplicating data.
